oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LeMat revolver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The LeMat revolver was developed by a group of Louisiana Confederates including Gen. P.G.T. Beauregard. The LeMat had a nine shot .40 caliber cylinder with a .63 caliber shotgun barrel beneath. The weapon delivered more firepower than any other revolver.; LeMats were manufactured in Paris, France and London, England and imported for Confederate use. This one is serial number 782. The LeMat was almost exclusively used by high ranking Confederate officers.
